metadata.title: CVE-2018-13304 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In libavcodec in FFmpeg 4.0.1, improper maintenance of the consistencybetween the context profile field and studio_profile in libavcodec maytrigger an assertion failure while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4,leading to a denial of service, related to error_resilience.c, h263dec.c,and mpeg4videodec.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.2-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.2-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.2-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.0.2-1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.0.2-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0.2-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.0.2-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.0.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.2-1').
